name: Sofitel Macau at Ponte 16

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Ponte 16 in a king room adjoining a 2x singles room, for our children.
reviews.title: High end luxury - without the price tag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From a design perspective this hotel is up there with the best. The fact that it is new is obviously a bonus with the lastest technology ( electronic curtains, LCD t.v.'s etc...) and the lastest decor styles. The attention to detail with the interior fit out is exceptional - every wall is either upholstered, papered or covered in joinery. The marble detailing and glass etching in the bathrooms is stunning. The screen on the windows is actually laser cut leather ! All fixtures and finishes are top-shelf with L'Occitane bathroom products, feather down doonas, excellent King Pillows, fluffy bathrobes, a valet, shoe horns and every other conceivable luxury you would (or should) expect of a 5*+ hotel.
reviews.title: NIce place to stay in Macau

reviews.text: The facilities in the hotel are good, with an excellent buffet breakfast offered at the main hotel and a good outdoor swimming pool - although it could be a bit deeper.
reviews.title: location, location, location---POOR!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cant comment on the casino as we are not gamblers but we were told it was your general run of the mill Casino. It certainly smelt like one.
reviews.title: Wow, one of the best

reviews.text: We were approached in the check-in queue and asked if we would like to upgrade to a Club Sofitel floor for an extra HK$595 p.n. per room, a decision we were so glad we made as we happily ate and drank our way through double that over the next 2 days. We also had our own concierge/check in,out , access to the Club Lounge and Internet and our Room was on the 16th floor with excellent views and almost no traffic/construction noise ( this may be an issue with low rooms).
reviews.title: French flair in former Portugese colony

reviews.text: I spent my summer in Macau/Taipa with my grandparents when I was a kid, so I know this place well. Partly because of the same, I don't really fancy seeing ugly and bulky casinos and hotels dominating the skyline of this tiny place. Ponte 16 is one of the few that is causing unbearable damage to the picturesque.
reviews.title: Luxury at reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area where Ponte 16 is located used to be a line of piers where fishing boats and goods ferries parked. It's not a pretty nice area per se, but a re-development after the trade died down is not a bad idea afterall. It's in the middle of almost everything, from hawkers' food (which I can assure you are excellent) to grand shopping and casinoing. You can actually walk to Hotel Lisbona/Wynn if you are in a good mood (and provided it's not too hot). Or to the Marine Museum (a nice one).
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.text: For the hotel itself, it's tastefully decorated from lobby to room. Not particularly spacious but the size is just right and the beds are comfy. Every detail has been looked carefully into. Although the casino is in a dominant location (can't fault that, it's Macau), the rooms and floor decoration bear no trace of the $$-minded passion. Well, I am comparing this to Star World (formerly Galaxy) & Rio Hotels.
reviews.title: Fantastic 5 Star Hotel

reviews.text: I booked through an agent in HK and obtained a good price w/o breakfast. So I can't comment on the quality of the food. The gym is nice. Service friendly. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Good location and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel looks amazing from the outside and the inside. Really looks liek a Vegas hotel. The rooms are nice with all the usual extras you would expect with this type of hotel. We were upgraded for free on arrival into a larger room which was excellent and the customer service was excellent including free bottles of water and cold face towels by the pool. The pool is very good with a jacuzzi attatched and a average size gym.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second stay in this new hotel.
reviews.title: Now it can be told!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Plush, opulent & modern hotel

reviews.text: And the second time was just last Thursday, Feb. 19, 2009.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

likes.disliked: — Front desk people are a bit slow.

reviews.text: I stayed at Sofitel for 2 nights/ 3 days, and this hotel is by far the most memorable and impressive hotel I have ever stayed at. I was impressed by everything, from atmosphere to service level to the cleaniness of the hotel.
reviews.title: What am amazing stay!

reviews.text: The rooms were very spacious and clean. I loved the decor and the color scheme used, very elegant. The bathroom offered both a shower stall and a bathtub, depending on what you prefer.Beautiful bathroom amenities were selected, to be exact, the luxury brand L'Occitane from France.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel with a fabulous location

reviews.text: Across from the nice, big bed, is a plasma TV hanging off the wall. Turndown service was a standard service, but you could also request them not to do so. Although I would admit it was a great feeling coming back from a wonderful day, having your bed set up for the night, slippers laid-out on the floor, the whole works.
reviews.title: Brand new Sofitel Macau

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel amenities were plentiful, gym, pool, conference rooms, wifi connections, etc. Everything from the lobby to the elevators exude a certain romantic elegance, from the giant discoball to the beautifully sculpted glass flowers on the walls.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Positioned on Macau's picturesque waterfront, Sofitel Macau At Ponte 16 is located in the center of the city and amidst the charming historical quarter with walking distance to St. Paul's Ruins and A-Ma Temple! The complex of restaurant, bar, recreational facilities, meeting and banquet venues, in-house casino and MJ Gallery ensures that Sofitel has created an exquisite world for lovers of "art de vivre". The hotel has an easy access to the major points of entry into Macau and offers its guests complimentary transfers to the Macau ferry terminal and GongBei border gate on the Ponte 16 casino shuttle buses.
